What information does the result of a transaction in Verus contain?

The result of a transaction in Verus contains several pieces of information, including:

* The transaction amount in VRSC
* The number of confirmations
* The block hash
* The block index
* The block time in seconds since the epoch (January 1, 1970, GMT)
* The transaction ID
* The transaction time in seconds since the epoch
* The time received in seconds since the epoch
* An array of details about the transaction, including the account and address involved, the category (send or receive), the amount, and the vout value
* An array of vjoinsplit information, including the anchor, nullifiers, commitments, macs, and changes to the transparent value pool
* The raw data for the transaction in hexadecimal format

#### Result:
```json
{
 "amount" : x.xxx,    (numeric) The transaction amount in VRSC
 "confirmations" : n,   (numeric) The number of confirmations
 "blockhash" : "hash", (string) The block hash
 "blockindex" : xx,    (numeric) The block index
 "blocktime" : ttt,    (numeric) The time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)
 "txid" : "transactionid",  (string) The transaction id.
 "time" : ttt,      (numeric) The transaction time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)
 "timereceived" : ttt,  (numeric) The time received in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)
 "details" : [
  {
   "account" : "accountname", (string) DEPRECATED. The account name involved in the transaction, can be "" for the default account.
   "address" : "VRSC_address",  (string) The VRSC address involved in the transaction
   "category" : "send|receive",  (string) The category, either 'send' or 'receive'
   "amount" : x.xxx         (numeric) The amount in VRSC
   "vout" : n,            (numeric) the vout value
  }
  ,...
 ],
 "vjoinsplit" : [
  {
   "anchor" : "treestateref",     (string) Merkle root of note commitment tree
   "nullifiers" : [ string, ... ]   (string) Nullifiers of input notes
   "commitments" : [ string, ... ]   (string) Note commitments for note outputs
   "macs" : [ string, ... ]      (string) Message authentication tags
   "vpub_old" : x.xxx         (numeric) The amount removed from the transparent value pool
   "vpub_new" : x.xxx,         (numeric) The amount added to the transparent value pool
  }
  ,...
 ],
 "hex" : "data"     (string) Raw data for transaction
}
```

What is the purpose of the "details" array in the transaction result?

The "details" array in the transaction result provides more information about the transaction, including the account and address involved, the category of the transaction (send or receive), the amount, and the vout value. This information can be useful for understanding the specifics of the transaction.

#### Result:

 "amount" : x.xxx,    (numeric) The transaction amount in VRSC

   "category" : "send|receive",  (string) The category, either 'send' or 'receive'

What is the "vjoinsplit" array in the transaction result, and what information does it contain?

The "vjoinsplit" array in the transaction result contains information about the joinsplit operation, which is a mechanism used in Verus to combine multiple transactions into a single transaction. The array contains information such as the anchor (the Merkle root of the note commitment tree), nullifiers (the nullifiers of the input notes), commitments (the note commitments for the output notes), macs (the message authentication tags), and changes to the transparent value pool (vpub_old and vpub_new).

#### Result:
```json
{
 "amount" : x.xxx,    (numeric) The transaction amount in VRSC
 "confirmations" : n,   (numeric) The number of confirmations
 "blockhash" : "hash", (string) The block hash
 "blockindex" : xx,    (numeric) The block index
 "blocktime" : ttt,    (numeric) The time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)
 "txid" : "transactionid",  (string) The transaction id.
 "time" : ttt,      (numeric) The transaction time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)
 "timereceived" : ttt,  (numeric) The time received in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)
 "details" : [
  {
   "account" : "accountname", (string) DEPRECATED. The account name involved in the transaction, can be "" for the default account.
   "address" : "VRSC_address",  (string) The VRSC address involved in the transaction
   "category" : "send|receive",  (string) The category, either 'send' or 'receive'
   "amount" : x.xxx         (numeric) The amount in VRSC
   "vout" : n,            (numeric) the vout value
  }
  ,...
 ],
 "vjoinsplit" : [
  {
   "anchor" : "treestateref",     (string) Merkle root of note commitment tree
   "nullifiers" : [ string, ... ]   (string) Nullifiers of input notes
   "commitments" : [ string, ... ]   (string) Note commitments for note outputs
   "macs" : [ string, ... ]      (string) Message authentication tags
   "vpub_old" : x.xxx         (numeric) The amount removed from the transparent value pool
   "vpub_new" : x.xxx,         (numeric) The amount added to the transparent value pool
  }
  ,...
 ],
 "hex" : "data"     (string) Raw data for transaction
}
```

The "hex" field in the transaction result contains the raw data for the transaction in hexadecimal format. This can be useful for debugging or examining the transaction in more detail.
